thread.title: Trump’s Army Secretary pick drops out citing business concerns
thread.title_full: Trump’s Army Secretary pick drops out citing business concerns - NY Daily News

author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: Trump’s Army Secretary pick drops out citing business concerns
text:
President Trump's pick for Army Secretary has pulled his name from consideration, citing concerns over the Defense Department's strict rules on business entanglements, according to a report.
Vincent Viola, a billionaire Wall Street broker and the owner of the Florida Panthers hockey team, was tapped by Trump in mid-December, but announced in a Friday night statement that his sprawling business interests made the confirmation process nearly impossible, according to the Military Times .
"I appreciate the confidence President Trump showed in me," Viola, a retired Army Ranger, said in a statement provided to the Military Times. "I offer my continued support for President Trump and his administration, and look forward to redoubling my effort to support the Army and its veterans as private citizens."
President Trump tapped Viola in mid-December. (CARLOS BARRIA/REUTERS) Viola had reportedly been looking into divesting from his stock trading company Virtu Financial in order to qualify for the top civilian Army title. He had apparently also considered rescinding ownership of the Panthers, according to sources.
STASI: Trump is destroying America one executive order at a time 
The White House did not immediately return a request for comment.
